Reviews.Title: Excellent All Around
Reviews.Author: Fireman "Gary"
Reviews.Content: I've always been curious about what goes on at home when I'm not there. What do my dogs do all day? Can I watch my new little baby play and maybe take its first steps while I'm at work? This product is one of the simplest electronic products I've ever set-up. All I had to do was plug-in the camera, attach it to my home router and log in to the Astak site. My cameras were up and running.This product can be used for so many different purposes: to be a video security/surveillance system, check on things at a business or home, or whatever else you can think of doing. Check out the stuff posted on You Tube. People actually caught people robbing their business.This is what I like about this product:1. Setup was a breeze2. Only one wire to plug it into an outlet for power.3. I can move the cameras around as needed. For example, some days I put it in my garage to watch the dogs while I'm gone. On other days, I have the camera sitting on the dresser in the babies room.4. They are linked to your internet wirelessly5. The website and camera functions are very easy to use6. The image quality is great and the night vision works awesome.7. I can share my camera with my family anywhere so that they can see whats going on. (Even my Brother-In-Law in the Army)8. The range of my camera seemed just as good or better than my wireless home phone.9. Works great with my iPhone to check in via the web.10. The Yoics software program is very easy to use and easy to see other family members camera on a secure network. ( Many additional features also for remote desktop applications)11. Directly posts videos to You Tube12. Email alerts, motion detection, scheduled recording times, etc.13. 270 degree turning radius with full tilt14. Audio- so you can remotely hear what's going on15. Remote viewing,sharing, and controllingThis is what I wish the product would do better:1. Provide me with an iPhone app soon so that I can quickly check-in with one push of a button2. Have a way for me to zoom into an area to get more clarity.3. Have a battery back-upOverall, I think the product is excellent for people that want to see what's going on in places when they are not there and they are not tech savy enough to hook up more difficult systems. I would recommend this for anyone and plan on buying more cameras in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, does what I need it to do
Reviews.Author: Paul Hee
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Initial setup very easy.- Able to view easily from the web on computer or iPhone.- Email alerts for motion detection works great.- Video capture works well and will automatically upload to You Tube.- Works well on wireless.- Came with a 2GB SD Card (maybe only for Costco purchases).- Night time pictures are decent, better than expected.Cons:- Initialy could not view from the Mac or PC. See FAQ: [...]- Software on the CD is worthless. Mac version did not work, didn't bother with the PC version. Recommend ignoring the CD.- Software downloaded from [...] for the Mac worked once, then after would never load. Ended up removing it. Recommend ignoring this software as well.- No ability to delete images or videos stored on the SD Card from the camera. You need to remove the SD Card and delete the files from a computer.- When trying to watch a video stored on the SD card, it may crash the browser. You need to save it to your computer first then play the file.==============================================================For those interested here's my setup guide:Mole Camera Setup:- Get started:  -- Plug in LAN cable.  -- Plug in power.- Register Your Camera:  -- Go to: [...]  -- Create a new account, it will detect your camera and bring up your camera's home page.  -- Note: If Yoics' site is down (unlikely), you can go directy to your camera's home page by typing in the IP address, e.g. 192.168.0.111- Update browser:  -- At this point your camera is running, but you may not see a picture.  -- Reason is that you need to install an ActiveX Plug-in and/or QuickTime.  -- Instructions: [...]- Setup Wireless:  -- Attach WiFi antenna.  -- From your camera's web site, click the [Advanced] --> [Network] tabs.  -- Click the [Search] button and select your router.  -- Enter in the security settings for your router.  -- Unplug the power to your camera, unplug your LAN cable, plug the power back in. This will reset the camera so that it will now start using WiFi.Setup Alerts and Remote Storage:- Setup email notification:  -- From your camera's web site, click the [Advanced] --> [e-mail] tabs.  -- For this you need to have an email account with SMTP. This is so that the camera can send the alert using this email account.  -- Enter the your email account settings.  -- Typical email settings: [...]- Setup Alarm:  -- From your camera's web site, click the [Advanced] --> [Alarm] tabs.  -- Check "E-mail Alarm".  -- Check "Send with Picture".  -- Check "Save Picture on the SD card".  -- Check `Save Video on the SD card". Must have this checked to upload to a remote storage.- Setup Remote Storage for Video (optional):  -- Create a YouTube or Twitter account. This is if you want to upload your videos on the web so you can view them easier.  -- You can make these uploads private so that no one else can view them.  -- From your camera's web site, click the [Advanced] --> [Remote Storage] tabs.  -- Enter your YouTube and/or Twitter account settings. Select "Private Youtube Upload" if you want to.  -- Note: You need to have selected "Save Video on the SD card".Setup Motion Detection and Schedule:- Setup Motion Detection:  -- From your camera's web site, click the [Advanced] --> [Motion detection] tabs.  -- Select the areas where you want the camera to detect motion. I just used one window and expanded it to the full screen.  -- Select the sensitivity for each window. I set mine to 26. At 45 I was getting too many alerts.- Setup Schedule:  -- This is when you want the camera's motion detection to be running. Generally you want to schedule it when you're not home.  -- From your camera's web site, click the [Advanced] --> [Schedule] tabs.  -- Set the days and times.- Setup Auto Capture (optional):  -- This is if you want to pictures to be taken at regular intervals.  -- I didn't bother with this.  -- From your camera's web site, click the [Advanced] --> [Remote Storage] tabs.Setup Camera as Virtual Web Server (Optional):Normally you should be able to access the camera from [...]However, if you want to remove any dependency on Yoics' server, then you can setup your router to operate the camera as a virtual web server. I did it mainly for fun.- Setup User Access:  -- Out of the box, camera authentication is not active, which is ok if you're going to access via Yoics' site. But if you want to access your camera directly then you'll want to enable authentication.  -- From your camera's web site, click the [Advanced] --> [User] tabs.  -- Check "Enable".  -- Enter passwords for Admin, User and Guest.- Find out your camera's IP Address:  -- From your camera's web site, click the [System] --> [Device Information] tabs.  -- Note the IP Address.  -- The default port is 80. Unless you changed it at [Advanced] --> [Network].- Log in to your router's home page:  -- Typically: [...]  -- Find out what your router's public WAN IP Address is. Finding this information depends on the router, e.g. 111.222.333.444  -- Go to the virtual server settings.  -- Select the public port you want to use. e.g. 6000.  -- Enter the camera's IP Address and port. e.g. 192.168.0.111 port: 80  -- Save the settings and you can now access your camera using your IP Address and port. In this example it would be: [...]

Reviews.Title: Not a bad camera; relatively easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Howie Dub
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this from Costco. I was looking for a wireless IP Camera to use as a baby monitor that could pan, tilt, and zoom (PTZ) and that I could view it from my computer or Android phone . This camera seemed to fit the bill. Setup was pretty easy and I can barely use Excel; I was able to connect it to my router via wifi fairly easily and could view it on my computer and my phone over the network by typing in the camera's assigned router IP address. While it says it supports all browsers, it works best with Internet Explorer. Unless I'm missing something, I could only get sound when using H.264 streaming using Chrome and Firefox. JPEG streaming would only produce a picture and no sound. I prefer using IE anyway, so it's no biggie to me, but might be to others. Also, there is virtually no delay with PTZ when using IE, but a slight delay with other browsers. PTZ was more delayed and the video choppy when using my Android phone. And since Android does not have a Quicktime plugin for their browser, I didn't have sound. They also have instructions on how to view the camera through dyndns.org if you were away from home without going through their Yoics website. This was the hardest part for me because I didn't know how to open a port on my router. Once I figured that out, it was easy. They say it's less safe, but someone would have to know your IP address and know which one of the 65,000 ports the camera was on. If you are paranoid about someone accessing your camera, you can always set up a security password in order to view the camera. I actually prefer going through dyndns as it's less choppy and it's free. I would recommend not going through their Yoics setup as it's not necessary and is only there so they can get you to sign up for their premium service. The night vision is good, although the edges of the video are a little dark. Motion detection is great; you can set up 4 zones and choose how big each zone is and how sensitive the detection is. Email notification setup was easy and pictures were sent quickly and came in pretty clear. I haven't tried the built-in DVR yet.Now for the things I don't like about this camera. As I mentioned earlier, I can't get sound when I use my phone's browser, but that's not a big deal. What I really wish you could do with this camera is turn off all the LEDs. Unless you cover up the LEDs, the camera isn't incognito at night. Sometimes our baby wakes up in the middle of the night and stares directly at the camera. Also, the IR lights around the camera used for night vision have a red glow and click when turning on and off; it would have been nice if they did not light up like our Summer Infant baby monitor camera and was quiet. It also gets a little warm to the touch. I would give this camera a 3.5 star if I could, but since I can't, I rounded up. I'm on the fence about returning this camera, but I have not found another one that is wireless and has all these features for about the same price. Turning off the LED lights and having a no-glow infrared would make this 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Just Bought My Second One
Reviews.Author: Water Dog "lake tech"
Reviews.Content: We just got our second Mole here at the lake, We've had one for about a year now and while this camera is not perfect, it is far better than any of the other cameras we have tried.  We've got a Foscam FI8918W and a Lorex LNE 4001 and they are far less of a camera than this one.  We have played with numerous high quality professional cameras (IE Samsung), and besides build quality all these cameras are a better choice and performers for the consumer.One thing that we did that made a big difference to our older camera is update the firmware, our newer camera had much better firmware and we even found a newer one on the Yoics Support forum than made it perform even better.  It is very nice to have the image player and a click to streaming option.The Good:-Email alerts and Private YouTube upload are fantastic.  If you have a Gmail account and you have it linked to your YouTube account you get video embedded in your email, which you cannot ask for better, we have an account just for our moles that make it into something of an online DVR.-Efficient H.264 video for high quality streams.-Color is much better in daylight than our other cams because of its mechanical IR filter.-We like Yoics, for dead simple setup and mobile viewing.-iPhone and Android App support via Yoics Launch and Yoics View (these are new and free! Total Bonus!)-Built in SD card storage for video and snapshots.-Works with MAC, PC, iPhone, Android.  One of the only cameras that works very well with the Mac OSX.-Much better than the flock of "professional" IP cameras that I've played with that only work with IE or proprietary software and no mobile support.The Bad:- Blinking light you cannot turn off.- MAC setup for streaming can be a challenge as you have to follow their FAQ to get it configured for quicklime (but worth it!)- 2 Way Audio only works with Internet Explorer on PC.- Clicks when the IR cutter switches in or out- PTZ noise is recorded and pretty loud.- No Sound on Mobile phones.- UI can be confusing to setup motion alerts and recording and you need to make sure you have all the boxes ticked under multiple settings to get what you want.- As easy as it is I can see how people might still get confused (but no different than the other cameras I've seen)-Playback from Memory card needs VLC player on some platforms (doesn't affect YouTube)Compared to our other cameras:-slightly closer view than our 2 other cameras giving it less of a field of view, they should offer different lenses.-Far better audio and video streaming than the Foscam that only does JPG/MJPG image streaming (and separate audio stream).-Works on the MAC, we cannot get the Foscam to reliably work on the Mac with sound.-Lorex LNE has ok streaming video, but its controls do not work at all, but the color quality is better on the Mole.-You must port forward the Foscam to view it remotely, Lorex LNE and Mole have Yoics which we use.-Much better Yoics implementation than the Lorex LNE.-Much better feature set in GeneralWhat you need to know:- On Mac Lion they changed QuickTime defaults so streaming will not work unless you configure QuickTime.- Some Windows Quicktime builds also needs configuration to get streaming (Apple get it straight!)- The default bandwidth settings might be to high if you have slower DSL connection, you may have to adjust this to not get video streaming to cut off.- There is likely newer firmware for the camera than what comes with it.- Camera uses Yoics for remote access, though you can set up remote access via port forwarding and dynamic DNS exactly like the foscam.  We for the most part like Yoics, and even more like their iPhone and Android apps (of which the only way the Mis'ess can use the cameras)Wish list for an IP camera:Flash streaming display for PC/MAC/Linux Viewing (IE RTMP)Apple Live Streaming for iPhone display.Streaming for Android (new androids support apple live streaming)2 way audio for mobile.In Conclusion I believe that the Astak Mole is the best of the current crop of PTZ cameras that we have seen, I've seen the other reviews and I can only think the negative ones on this camera have to resolve around older firmware and not being able to setup QuickTime correctly.  These are the only two issues that I see being a problem with this camera.  Having said that, although it isn't perfect, the performance, feature set, ease of installation and image quality is the best of the cameras that we at lake tech have seen.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: B. bigenho "derka derka"
Reviews.Content: This camera delivered as promised with sheer ease of setup. There are cheaper wireless IP cameras out there but guaranteed they can be very frustrating in the setup process. I tried couple of other brands but they all require that you have technical knowledge about network protocol, port forwarding, dynamic DNS, etc. By comparison, the Mole's instruction was easy, non-technical and I was viewing the camera within a few minutes. Works well with the iPhone so that I can view the camera from anywhere.Prompt tech suport is another plus. Many reviews of products neglect to examine and report on a company's tech support. What takes companies like Apple from good to great is their outstanding tech support.There are a lot of extra bells and whistles with this camera (video recording, motion activated capture, email alerts when motion is detected, etc.). Since I use this camera as a "granny cam" I haven't had the need for the extras but it's good to know they're there should I need it in the future.

Reviews.Title: Practical and Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: J. Avery
Reviews.Content: Here are the things I liked the best about the Astak "Mole":  1. The wireless control features, worked great from my computer and was fun to do.  2. The email notification worked great.  3. Video sharing was easy. (youtube, etc.)I don't think the camera works well outdoors, but other than that, I can see this as a good tool for the casual user.

Reviews.Title: Good to have one
Reviews.Author: Lazy Old Man
Reviews.Content: The wireless controls are the best feature about this camera, and it also has a nice design. I liked that no matter where I moved it in the house, in connected back to the network. A good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: I use mole to monitor my store though iPhone when I am away
Reviews.Author: Bman
Reviews.Content: I'm not very tech-saavy, and I wanted to set up a motion activated camera in my small business for safety at night. The camera was really easy to set up, and the great image quality was impressive. I rely on the night vision feature, and I was surprised to see how clear the image was up to 25 ft. Compared to most cameras I've had in the past, the quality is way better with the Mole. It's also nice that you can access the camera from your home computer or wherever, just in case I have an alarm going off at the store. I haven't used all of the cameras features, but for my needs, the Mole is great.

Reviews.Title: a very good baby monitoring camera
Reviews.Author: Renee G
Reviews.Content: i have a 2-year old baby so i really need a camera that i watch them when im at work. after looking at different brands for a while, i picked this camera because the features they posted. i was a little confused when i first got the camera. i called their tech support line and they answered quickly and helped me install it. now i can use my iphone to watch my baby. and i also upload some of the interesting videos on the youtube so i can share them with my family members and friends. im very glad that i chose this camera!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what i need!!
Reviews.Author: Tech Guy
Reviews.Content: I have used ip cams from different brands, but this is the one I will only recommend. I think I know whats going on in this type of cameras pretty well. Here are what I found, and wish these ideas can help whoever wish to purchase an ip camera.1. Easy installation.Not technically plug & play, but it really gives the ease of setup. I usually need to configure my router to install an ip camera, and it normally wil take about half hour. But this one, it only needs me to hoop it up to the router and run the cd. I got it setup within 10 minutes!2. Image quality.This one has the best ip camera quality I have ever seen! It doesn't lose any color during day time and also it has a pretty good night vision.3. Motion detectionIt has built-in motion detection sensor for video recording, and the very important point - email notification with snap shot picture. I need the camera to let me know if something goes on when I am not at home!4. Remotely access & PT controlIf I receive an email with a picture, I can easily access and control the camera with my iphone. This can help a lot for any false alarm.5. Running 24/7 without additional requirementsThis is why I need an ip camera, not a web cam! I don't need to leave my computer open at all time when I go out for a trip.Now, here are some suggestions:1. Out-door versionFor me, I wish this camera can be used out door so much~2. ZoomSometimes a zoom function can help a lot on a smaller screen.

Reviews.Title: A very easy setup and useful IP camera
Reviews.Author: kc
Reviews.Content: The Mole IP camera can be setup either by Port forwarding method or use Yoics.com service. If you have some network knowledge then you can use the port forwarding method in your router to setup this IP camera. If you don't then use Yoices.com service is the easiest way to setup the IP camera in the market. The only requirement of Yoics service is to setup an account with Yoics.com then you also register IP camera to the server then your are ready.This Mole IP camera has the best video quality compare with Panasonic, Linksys and Logitech which I have own. The camera's video displays a nice and clear picture in the day time and about 25 ft distance at the night time.The Mole IP camera has a build-in SD card DVR which can be recorded a motion video to the SD card when it detects a motion. In addition, it also send an email with a picture and/or upload a video to the Youtube or a FTP server.This IP camera supports two ways audio when you use Windows IE. It also works with Apple Mac or Linux. Another feature is you can view the video from iPhone, iPad or Google phone.I use Mole IP camera not only for security purpose but also to monitor my teenage boy to see when he is coming home or going out. So if he comes home, I will receive an email with a photo right away. Sometimes, I use this IP camera to monitor my kitchen area at night to see if there is any mouse activies .Finally, I love my Mole IP camera and I believe this is the best IP camera that i have ever seen with the best quality and price.

Reviews.Title: Great Night IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: I just read a news about a guy called police after he got the self phone email alarm from his camera. I think this is exactly what I need for my second house. I started to search on the web for suitable products and the astak camera came out. I bought it, spent about 15 minutes to setup and now it is working like a charm. I got a whole bunch of emails in the first day because I set the sensitivity too high. Now it is working perfectly along with the youtube upload. Great product!"

Reviews.Title: Worked for a While
Reviews.Author: Sergio Santos "SharperImage"
Reviews.Content: When i recieved the cam, set-up was a breeze and worked as defined. However, a few weeks later i noticed that the camera could not longer pan more than 25%, and would start to pan (only 25%) and tilt endlessly. Finally i contacted the manufacture who recommended that I restart the until. That seemed to work well, but only for a few days. Unfortuntily, I was forced to return the unit to Amazon. I did like the camera and it's functioanlity, but the pan feature was critical for me. Hopefully they can get that corrected.

Reviews.Title: More Than Just a Security Camera
Reviews.Author: Amelia
Reviews.Content: I loved the initial concept of the mole, but I did not realize how versatile its abilities were until I owned one. This is not just some high-tech security camera. It is great for my own personal interests, like checking on my kids or cat at home. I really enjoyed playing with the camera. With how often I want to use it, I am extremely grateful that the camera is easy to use and set up. I would not use the camera as often as I do if it were not as user-friendly as it is.

Reviews.Title: I would recommend this item to my friend
Reviews.Author: Penny
Reviews.Content: I am really having a good time with my camera. This camera does not have complicating set up like other camera that i need to call someone to set it up. THe live streaming is just as good as being home. The delay is acceptable for me, because every camera has delay. I would recommemd this to my friend for sure.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: dipthongdude
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera now for about 8 months.  I have it installed at my vacation home, viewing through a window to the outside where my boat lift is.  So, I am able to remotely monitor and/or remotely pan the camera if I want to watch live.  I have it set up to email me still pictures whenever it detects movement.  To use the mole for these purposes, I can attest, it works very well.  Other features (youtube, twitter, mobile phone)  I have not tried.The set up was a bit of a problem, I made a "beginner" mistake by connecting mole to computer (by Ethernet cable).  It is supposed to be connected to the ROUTER by ethernet cable for the setup process.  ANYWAY, Once I figured that out it went okay.  One disappointment:  I was hoping to be able to use the night vision feature, but, unless the camera is mounted outside, it won't work well at all, reason is that the infra red light, needed to "see" at night, reflects back off the window glass and almost blinds the Mole.  If you carefully experiment with the right angle, you can lessen that to some degree, but it is awkward, and I found it not worth doing.  The infra red night vision does work well when the mole is watching inside.I see others have complained that you might have to pay for the web portal to monitor/control the Mole.  At this point, you do not, you have access free, but it is time limited (I think 30 minutes per day).  So, if you want to constantly monitor something, you will have to pay for the "PRO" version (can't remember what it costs now, but look it up, not too bad, I think) I think you also have the option to set things up so that you do not have to go through their portal at all, but that process looks complicated to me, so I've never done that.  (And, as you can imagine the web site doesn't really give much in direction about that).ANYWAY:  I like it, it works well for what I want, once it is set up it hasn't given me any problems.  I can unplug it and move it to a different window, upstairs, downstairs, whatever, and once plugged back in it automatically connects to network, no further set up needed.  At this point it mostly catches the action of some outside cats who like to stalk around the dock.  Since I have it at vacation home, it is nice to be able to monitor what is going on around the dock area.  It was very useful when we had some work being  done on the bulkhead replaced, I couldn't be there, but could monitor what was going on.PROS:  Set up wasn't too bad  Sends pictures triggered by motion to email  You can remotely view live and pan/tiltCONS:  Can't use night vision through a window

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD CAMERA!!!!!!!1
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: There are some features are really good in Mole camera. I'm using this camera to watch my dogs as they are hyper all the timePro:1. The installation is fairly quick. Plug the camera to the router and sign up for an account. That's ALL!!!!!!!!2. I can see my camera anywhere I would like to.3. Motion detection accompany email alarm shows me if my dogs are bitting stuff4. SD card is very thoughtful for me to playback5. Upload the video on my Youtube to show off how cute my dogs areCon:1. The camera is not for out door usage2. It does not support Apple that wellIn over all, Mole is a very good camera, it has all the function that I want. Works as defined. Thank you the company who made this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awsome Image
Reviews.Author: David Arango
Reviews.Content: Wired works excellent, wireless is a little slow but what I liked best was the quelity of the video

Reviews.Title: great technology
Reviews.Author: maschngon
Reviews.Content: These cameras are amazing!  I bought one set up was very easy. It backs  to your you tube account once motion is detected also emails a pic once moiton is detected. it takes less than a minute for video to upload to you tube and also instantly emails a pic of the security breech. I'm buying a two more. I have older cameras backed up to a hard drive in my addict but this is easier and cost a lot less

Reviews.Title: Very good product
Reviews.Author: Jan Zworecki
Reviews.Content: I was considering some sort of security camera for over a year now. I have three dogs and my wife would like to see what's going on at home using her cell phone. I travel a lot and happened to be at Costco in Auburn Hills. I saw this product and decided to purchase it. I read a lot of negative reviews on this product prior to making the purchase and I was very hesitant but did it anyway. I have had the system for nearly a month now and so far I am very satisfied. A couple of comments. Setup is somewhat tricky. Looks like there are three different sets of instructions and are redundant. I am not IT expert by any means but I was able to set it up in less than 30 min. Once setup, the system has been working flawlessly. I am using Lenovo laptop or iPad 2 with no problems. My Blackberry is working as well but has a tendency to lockup. I suppose is the phone issue more than anything related to the camera system. My wife is using iPhone 4 with no issues as well. From the remote location I can move the camera in any direction I want to. Small delay but I expected it since the system is wireless and so are my portable devices I use to view it. Great picture quality and works amazingly well at night. The software also gives you a lot of options to adjust several different settings from picture quality to sensitivity of motion control. So far I am very pleased with the system and highly recommend to anyone looking for a simple and inexpensive solution.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: There is not a better wireless camera out there.  It connects to YOICS, which gives you internet access to your camera everywhere (which is free unless you want the Pro version, which is $30/year).  There's a free iPhone app so you can monitor your camera.  I've used one for about 3 years and just bought another one.  It has night vision, which allows you to see in the dark, even pitch black.  You can control the camera remotely to pan, tilt, scan, etc.  This seller is great!

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Ordinary guy
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for a week now in a location it probably wasn't meant for.  It sits on a second floor window sill overlooking my backyard and two troublesome neighbors. Daytime images become washed out when the sun is overhead but it really performs great during dusk and darkness.  It does need a certain amount of ambient light after dark but it has good range and  clear images....especially for it's size. It's portability is a real plus.  I take it inside before bedtime because of the unstable weather which is now wet and chilly, it is meant for indoor use. All special features work fine such as motion detection, panning, left/right/up or down movement and still or video pictures. It gets five stars because it does a lot for the money.  Only time will tell if it lasts.

Reviews.Title: Works well for price.... Simple setup.. One design flaw..
Reviews.Author: Stephen Stetzer
Reviews.Content: I use my MOLE to view the lake from a window.  The setup using Yoics for controled on line use is simple, though I did change it to use an IP address on my web site.  I am satisfied with the camera as a basic, economical unit with one, for me, major gripe.The microphone is very sensative and there is no way to turn it off!  You CAN select to Listen or Mute but you can NOT stop it transmitting sound.  Seems like they could make a software fix.This can be a problem if you use MOLE on the network as conversation can be clearly heard from some distance. As a baby cam, that is a good thing I guess.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with the quality and customer service.
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: Astak mole camera has everything that I wanted. I am using it to watch my kids for the day care. The size of the camera makes the nanny aware of that I am watching him and it worked. However, I don't know how to turn off the power light and two of the lights on the button. If any body know give me the instruction on how to turn it off.

Reviews.Title: Honestly does not live up to the hype.
Reviews.Author: J. Defreitas "OK"
Reviews.Content: In a Word: Awful.In a Sentence:  This camera had so much promise, I wanted to like it, it looks really cool, but ultimately it disconnects so regularly from my wireless network that I can't count on it to be my eyes and ears when I am not home.In a Paragraph:  Straight out of the box this camera is aesthetically pleasing to look at, and it does setup fairly quickly straight out of the box. However, the more you use the software the more you'll hate it.  The con's far out weigh any benefits that I would like to focus on. If you plan on mounting this camera to look outside, say through your kitchen window to monitor your vehicles say at night time, then you have to manually turn off the night vision, otherwise you will see nothing but brightness from the infrared light reflecting off the glass back at the camera lens. Even if you do turn off the camera's infrared lights, you will quickly see that the camera can't see much going on at all, the images becomes milky, grainy and the quality of the camera is made very apparent.  This is fairly typical of cameras in the $200 range, but I will say that TrendNet does make a wireless N IP camera of which I also own ($150 range), and the night viewing aspect is by far 1000% better than that of this camera.  Now I could go to the trouble of setting up and independent infrared system that turns on at night time that I could point towards areas of interest, but this requires more money and time and this is not something I feel anyone should have to do. The idea of remote viewing and controlling this camera via an iPhone is neat concept but the reality of it is it's a joke, the image is blurry, it doesn't move very fast and you will have the feeling that your suffering from technological hype that can't match your expectations to any degree of satisfaction.  Bottom-line this is a camera that needs refinement, the makers would do well to read my constructive review and make changes that allow for the technologies that they have hyped to meet up with our ever increasing expectations.Comparison: This camera is like expecting Windows 7 but instead they shipped you Windows Vista without any service packs updates.Conclusion:  Keep looking for something else, depending on your needs, this camera for outdoor viewing is a total nightmare.  The camera disconnects from my network at least 3 times per week, and the bottom line is this is not a camera you can depend on to be a second set of eyes and ears for you when your not at home.

Reviews.Title: Web connections last for 2 hours & Yoics Pro Plan  $24.95/yr
Reviews.Author: Alexander W. Davidson "awd"
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is not bad but it won't work for my needs.  I like the fact you can use any browser but Chrome, Firefox etc. has it's limitations.  IE works best in that you have the capability to capture and record.  It seems that most cameras are Windows based with is unfortunate.  I'm looking for a camera that has PTZ, ~50db S/N ratio, Mac OS support, indoor/outdoor, built-in webserver, SD card.Read this off the Yoics website once I created my account.Upgrade Your Account NowYoics Pro Plan  $24.95/yrMember Account Summary  Feature  Usage  Expires  PRO Service  Your account allows you toCreate 10 local services.Create 25 total services.Share your services with guest users.Allow up to 10 guests per service.Up to 10 active web connections.Up to 100 daily web connections.Create local proxies to local web content.Create up to 2 shared camera(s) per computer.Web connections last for 2 hours.Web connections running at maximum speed.  Full description  12/27/2012Get More out of your Yoics account by upgrading to our Pro account. The Pro Plan makes it easier to use Yoics with multiple desktops, better web and mobile access, easier sharing for guest access and other premium applications.- Increase your maximum number of Yoics services- Longer mobile and web access times- Faster mobile and web access connections- Easily share your Yoics products and services with non-Yoics users- Turn your PC into a remote accessible Webcam and IP Camera surveillence DVR- Plus more features being added all the time

Reviews.Title: Almost good
Reviews.Author: C. Arnaud
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a remote location, but when it was time to connect it to Wifi I discovered that it doesn't support the character "&" in the pass-phrase. As I couldn't change the router's setup, the camera returned to the shop.This is poor SW, why not support all the characters? Also, usually when you enter 64 characters, it means you're entering the key itself, that works on other devices which don't support all the characters.Otherwise the general impression was good, a bit flimsy as you would expect from cheap companies.The network connection is handled by Yoics, a SF Bay area company, and that's a great thing, no need to configure your router for port forwarding, secure, ... and free.Too bad the camera SW is so poorly designed.

Reviews.Title: Fine IP Camera - but.......
Reviews.Author: DNP77 "DNP77"
Reviews.Content: I bought this item not at Amazon.com but at Costco.  Probably could have saved money by buying at Amazon but what the hey.  In any event this is a fine camera.  Works as claimed and is quite easy to set up.  It will email you if motion is detected and it will put the video on YouTube so it is easy to access.The setup is easy although the manual could be clearer.  But after a day or two you will have it down pat.  Pictures and videos that come from the camera are good resolution.  There is not much to dislike about this product.  Not to mention a good price.Later edit by me:  I bought 2 of these and the first one stopped the emailing of photos or videos after about 6 months.  The other one still works as intended.  The second camera still gives a live picture - it just doesn't send out any emails with captured photos.  Partly a bummer.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Solaris "SUN"
Reviews.Content: I bought this from local Costco warehouse on a deal (160$) and I'm really satisfied with this.  Night vision is way better than i expected and its very clear. I really wondered why it didn't get good review's here.  Setup is is very easy (may be i'm tech guy).  I worked little bit on motion detection (set to 36) to set it right and tested it that it keeps sending email right away when i cross the camera. I'm just saving photo's everyone hour on the given SD card.  It really works well in my Iphone (bought a 3rd party app, which supports very well).For access outside your home network, i just tweaked my router port forwarding and the best way to do is change the default port from 80 to higher port which you feel secure.  I was monitoring my home outside and it really ran well.Cons:Price  No support on my NAS synology DS1511+ .  The 2G SD card (atleast in Costco version) provided with this  is junk and i trashed it and bought 8G card.  No HTTPS, but who cares, if some ones hacks, thanks for monitoring my home! :-)

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Kend "draks"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my vacation home but first had to set it up at home. I have ATT Uverse which is notoriously tricky to setup for cameras that need to punch out thru the firewall. After I could not do it, I IM'd support and the set it up for me in literally 5 minutes over the internet. It was truly the most amazing support experience i've ever had. Fast, efficient and very to the point.  I was up and running and now I can view video from my iphone or laptop from anywhere at anytime - just a great camera.  I now leave it at home and it sends me emails when it detects motion (like when my kids get home from school) so that I can know they are around.I do set the motion trigger for a very limited window as it will send an email a minute when it detects motion - and that will fill up your inbox in a day so be careful.I tried several others to no avail. I just couldn't configure them to punch out thru the ATT (2wire) router.  So I took them back and am now very, very happy with my mole cam.

Reviews.Title: This item is such a blessing! Now we have no worries when we leave our pets with a petsitter!
Reviews.Author: Kathryn W. Lee "Shopper Maniac"
Reviews.Content: Now we have no worries! This works so well for monitoring our pets when we are out of town and have hired a petsitter. We ordered another, less expensive IP camera and it was impossible to set up - This Mole camera was set up in 1 hour and works wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: Remote Access is Easy
Reviews.Author: Soren "Soren"
Reviews.Content: I initially did not consider this camera because it had a mere 3 star rating on Amazon out of 53 reviews.  However, after buying two other surveillance cams (and returning them after hours of frustration) I stumbled upon this camera at Costco.  I decided to give it a chance and am very glad I did.  It was set up for remote viewing within 10 minutes, whereas the FOSCAM took me around 20 hours of trying one thing after another with no success for remote viewing.  Surprisingly, the FOSCAM is rated much higher on Amazon than this camera, but it apparently has to do with ISP and router compatibility.  I didn't even have to log in to my router to configure this camera...it configured itself.

Reviews.Title: Poor Video Quality
Reviews.Author: Naughty Garfield
Reviews.Content: I have different types of IP Camera, one from Linksys/Cisco and now I bought this Astak Mole from Costco. Boy what a difference in video quality, let me first say the video on Linksys wasn't top notch, but I figured this is normal for this type of cameras as they are not high end. But when you setup the Astak Mole it was a whole different story. You will see artifacts and blurry, I have tried three Astak Mole because I need it at three different locations and all of them are horrible!Bottom line: if you just want to see just movements this is fine, but if you want to see anything better, PLEASE DON'T BUY THIS IP CAM!

Reviews.Title: mole camera
Reviews.Author: charles m jackson
Reviews.Content: very easy to setup compared to other wireless cameras. video is high quality and doesn't require lots of adjusting.I wished they made an outdoor wireless camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Terri G
Reviews.Content: The features we love the most with this camera are the wireless connection and the ability to view with an app on the iPhone. The set-up was easy, the picture is great with light and without. We use this camera at our second home with it directed at the thermostat. My husband always feels better knowing that he can check to make sure the furnace is running by checking on the temperature in the house. When we stay up there, we also use it to check in on our dog. The camera easily turns and tilts with the controls on the laptop and through the app. We love the peace of mind that comes with knowing we can rely on this camera to keep an eye on things from a remote location. We definitely recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Best Ever
Reviews.Author: Mohammed Azaz
Reviews.Content: this is my 20th camera, great for business monitoring. good for wireless setup. easy for self install. can store to remote NAS.

Reviews.Title: I have two!
Reviews.Author: TimM
Reviews.Content: I currently have two of these cameras.  I bought the first one a couple years ago. A few months ago the camera lost it's ability to pan and tilt. I did not personally observe any type of physical abuse happen to the unit but I do live amongst other beings.  So I cannot say that 'nothing happened to the camera that may have caused the issue'. The camera was set up in numerous places according to our needs so it was not stabilized ( tied down ) by screws or the like.  I have liked the camera and have used it almost everyday I have had it for home security and watching our pets at home while we are away from home. I have liked all it's features and it's ability to actually do all that it purports to be able to do.  I would suppose that the mere fact that I have bought a second unit should say something about how I have liked the unit.  The camera pictures are clear & colors are good.  The night vision and wireless working distance is acceptable. The newest one works as good as the first one.  I now use the first camera as a stationary camera.  All in all I think the unit is worth the money for it's quality. It does what I need it to do.  TimM

Reviews.Title: Excellent all-in-one solution
Reviews.Author: dcmacdon
Reviews.Content: I bought the MOLE camera for one location and was so pleased, I bought another for a second location.  I had been looking for a solution that satisfied many needs: it can be remotely accessed over the net, it's wireless to the router, it self-boots after the power fails, self-adjusting for time-of-day sync, has motion detection and captures pics and video (also downloadable remotely), notifies by e-mail when motion detection is triggered, has 360 degree pan, excellent color and resolution (better than all others in this price range).  For the price, this product had it all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality, reliable webcam
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I bought this at Costco, several years ago.  I was so happy with it, I bought another.  I have used them mainly as baby monitors.  I like that it can pick up audio, and the night vision is excellent.  The pan/tilt feature works well.  I can easily use it with my iPhone or other computer to view the cam.  I have used it also with the iCam software.  Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Solid little network camera
Reviews.Author: R. Passionino
Reviews.Content: The Astak Mole Pan/Tilt Network camera with night vision has been a fantastic little addition to my home.  I got the camera about a year ago right after I got a puppy.  Now I no longer have to worry about what sort of trouble she is getting into because I can log in at work or on my iPhone and watch the destruction happening in real time.  No more coming home to surprises, I can actually see her ripping the pillows off from the couch, shredding the mail, chewing up all my tupperware and wooden spoons, pulling the silicone off my frying pan handles.  Its great.  And with the interactive pan and tilt functions, I have placed the camera at a central location in my house and I can watch her run outside to the back yard pull up whole bushes and drag them through the dog door into the living room and scatter the dirt around.  I have hooked up a speaker to it as well to be able to communicate to her but apparently a speaker isn't as effective as being there in person.  The night vision feature works great as well, I can clearly see her and her beady little eyes quite well.  Connection to it has been good, I do find that it drops me some times but I can't tell if it my laptop or iPhone service being spotty or the network.  I usually just reconnect and its fine.  Overall I would highly recommend getting one of them.  A great product.

Reviews.Title: The little camera that does a lot
Reviews.Author: Tad Rubin
Reviews.Content: Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera (Black) This is the third camera that I have bought to complete the coverage of my house. They work extremely well indoors and put out a great picture.  With the rich feature functionality I was able to replace the majority of my existing alarm system and the monthly service monitoring fees. Now I am alerted with a picture on my IPHONE any time there is motion in key areas of my house.  If there is a Robery I can call the police. Setup was a piece of cake. It just works great!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: OCNJ
Reviews.Content: I now have several of these cameras at both of our homes.  I previously used Panasonic but these cameras work flawlessly and the iPhone app is terrific.  You won't be disappointed with this camera in any way.  It is easy to install and works amazing in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Astek Mole Camera
Reviews.Author: crutchman
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 of these cameras to use as security devices. Two of them are in my home and the third is at my mothers. I access them with DYNDNS. They are extremely easy to set up using the documentation provided and if you're more advanced those options are easy to accomplish in forwarding the ports externally. The night vision works well. Its great with an iPhone and iTouch for viewing and manipulating the pan tilt. One option if they can incorporate it would be zoom. Great product at a great price.Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera (Black)

Reviews.Title: I love my Mole security camera
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: I love my mole security camera. I have it now for about 2 years, I could look at my office using my iphone from Malaysia, India, Australia while I was away on vacation with full controls. I highly recommend it to all.Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera (Black)

Reviews.Title: Love my Mole
Reviews.Author: MountainMont
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier.  I have a second home and use my mole to keep tabs on it and "visit" when I am missing our mountain home.  I have alerts that tell me when someone enters our house and can login into the mole and see who is there and what they are doings.  Change the direction of the mole and I can see the sunset or the snow.  It is everything I want.

Reviews.Title: Astak Mole Camera
Reviews.Author: THERESA
Reviews.Content: Astak Wireless IP Network Camera, Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, 802.11b/g, Motion Detection, You can View it from your iPhone and Upload your video to YouTube Directly.This is a nifty device. You can view, record audio/video and photo from anywhere there is internet access. Recently my property was tented for termites and I had to leave for a period of time and allow access to the workers. I kept an EYE on things while the work was being done and I was away. It's a great little device for the money and easily sets up in minutes with restricted access. A very good investment for peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't leave home without it!
Reviews.Author: L. Benjamin
Reviews.Content: We use our mole to "watch" our vacation house when we're not there.  While we've never captured anything criminal happening, we did capture some surprising trespassing by a neighbor. We have also had the fun of watching lots of wildlife approach our front door and we've been able to observe animal behavior we never would have seen so close up otherwise - including a bird sitting on the windowsill right in front of the camera lens just staring back at us! I love being able to tune in live as well as to review the SD card remotely. My only wish is for a weatherproof camera - we have ours on the inside, because we don't have a protected space, aimed out through the window and we cannot use it at night because there is too much glare off the glass. It would also be nice to have a wider angle lens, but all in all it has given us a great sense of security. It would be perfect if we were using it only indoors.

Reviews.Title: astak mole IP camera
Reviews.Author: djhaase
Reviews.Content: I have purchased two of these cameras.  I am using the wireless capability.  I downloaded the app so I can monitor the cameras from my android phone.  I have remotely controlled the pan/tilt from a web browser, but not with the android app, but I think I have that capability.I have the cameras setup so they email me a photo when it detects motion.  The instructions for setting them up are not that clear, but if you go to the website you should be able to figure it out.  If you setup the camera to record movement, then it will record that movement on the sd card.  If/when the sd card gets full, then it will start deleting the oldest recording to record the current recording.  I have not used the capability of uploading a recording to youtube.  The night vision is so/so, but for the price and the capability I am very pleased.  That is why I bought a second one about a month after I purchased the first one.

Reviews.Title: Overall a great camera
Reviews.Author: JohnstoneIT
Reviews.Content: We initially tested one of these cameras to test simply based on the price. We were pleasantly surprised to see what a clear picture it provides. We now use the MOLE in our 5 store locations to oversee the sales counters, for both security & visual parts cross-reference. I would give it a 5-star rating, if the company provided slightly better technical support, but the product itself is an excellent camera, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: works as advertised
Reviews.Author: engineer
Reviews.Content: I bought this, hardwired it to my router, installed the software, completed the setup and wireless was up and running.  From here I moved it to an area where its field of view catches both entrances to the house.I use it to monitor for movement in the house when I am not there.  You can set the trigger window to ignore the dog when she is on the floor but trigger if she gets on the chair or table.  The hardest part was to setup email yet I figured that out in about an hour.  Without any computers on in the house, I get an email to my phone whenever movement is detected.  I can also adjust the cameras position from my phone. The picture quality is good but a little blurry if the subject is moving.  Overall I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Astak Pan IP Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Tom K
Reviews.Content: I have a Astak IP Network Camera about 4month ago, reason i brought this camera was reasonable price.and i didn't expect a lot from this camera originally.but this is a great! i have been use for my princess(pet; golden retriever). it is more than what i expected.even day and night, this works great for our family.First, Easy to set-upSecond, i can contol the camera in my smart phone at anywhere, anytime i wantThird, it is a lots of functions; such as motion detect, two way audio support, night vision, email notification, and more.i just bought it another one for my worki have strongly recommand to all my friends too.

Reviews.Title: My Mole Does It Right
Reviews.Author: Pjmack
Reviews.Content: About 2 years ago I installed a Astak Mole in my store. Setup was extremely  easy. I watch my General Store from my house on my PC, from my iPhone and iPad when I am not at home. The iPad and iPhone apps are the easiest to use. It always connects, every time. I liked the Mole so much I bought a second one to keep an second eye on my business. I would highly recommend this camera for keeping a eye on your sleeping child or whatever you want to need an eye on!

Reviews.Title: Mole Security Cameras
Reviews.Author: kbbdvm
Reviews.Content: After a few business break ins, my insurance company requested video monitors to secure the premises after hours. The Mole was an easy to install and inexpensive answer. Installation alone has stopped the intrusions. The cameras (I have two) are set to detect motion on an after hours schedule. Camera activation sends a message and picture to my email address, and starts a video clip that is recorded on You Tube, so even if an intruder immediately smashes the camera, they are already immortalized off premise for the police.  A second nice feature is the remote programing through my iPhone. I can access, and even re-aim the cameras remotely. Both my front office and the inventory area  can be monitored, and employees feel more protected from armed robbery or snatch and go theft. Inventory shrinkage is down already. I may put in another unit in the future.

Reviews.Title: Eye in the sky!
Reviews.Author: Molefan2012
Reviews.Content: Love this. Bought two when our newborn was born and had to go back to work after maternity leave. I would watch him from work and made sure the nanny was following the feeding schedule and cleaning the house. Felt secure and never failed. I used it from my iPad, iPhone pc! You can move it to any side and works with or without lighting. Perfect for those that want to keep and eye on this and extremely reliable.

Reviews.Title: Great Petcam :-)
Reviews.Author: Cordula E. Hodgins "Cordula H."
Reviews.Content: I bought the mole to monitor my two little dogs.The set up was real easy.I created an account and the cam will send me a photograph every 30 minutes.It makes me feel good knowing that they are doing fine while I am at work.I gave my parents a password to access my cam via computer.My dad can change the viewing angle and live view the pups.I love my mole and recommend it highly for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: It's really wonderful!
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: I love it! We have it set up at our vacation home and now, no more worrying about what's happening at the property! We can access it any time over the internet and just look around to see if anything is going on! It even sees well in the dark! We have it on a WI-FI system there so wherever there's a wall power plug nearby, we can set it up and then always have the ability to check the area, wherever in the world we may be (literally). We recently went back to the property, unplugged it and stuck it away for awhile and during the time they changed the access code to the WiFi and I wasn't sure how to get it back on. I called tech support and they were absolutely outstanding!They had me up & running in about 5 minutes, even though I bought the product over 2 years ago!

Reviews.Title: Easy Set-up Monitor from anywhere
Reviews.Author: TJ in MI
Reviews.Content: I purchase my first Astak Mole camera, had it about a week and purchased a second. They are super easy to set up, and when I did have a reconfiguration question I discovered that their FREE tech support is excellent. If you are looking for a wireless camera with lots of versatility this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: fantastic *****
Reviews.Author: Albert
Reviews.Content: This is a must to watch when you're away from home. The camera rotates so you can see all around the room. this is great. I recommed this product very highly. This is a must if you are away from home a lot.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: John Eaton "HD"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to have as an additional i accessory for my business. Along with locks, heating, music, controlled from iPhone,itouch, iPad, this camera works great across the internet from your I device. Carrys audio and video, and can me pan and scan frommyour idevice accross the Internet. Would recommend to any one looking for a security cam while on vacation or just everyday use.

Reviews.Title: defective Mole
Reviews.Author: Stephen W. Buckley
Reviews.Content: I have had another Mole camera which worked fine. After I set this camera up I realized that the wireless range was only about 10 feet. Their tech could not help and told me to send camera back.

Reviews.Title: >>>BE FOREWARNED: THEY APPEAR TO BE OUT OF BUSINESS<<<
Reviews.Author: name not provided "none"
Reviews.Content: Bought mine at Costco, but it sat unopened for a couple years, until now. Tried to install it, found it wasn't recognized by my win7, regardless of disabling firewall and virus-scan, and so called cust. service. twice. On two diff dates a couple weeks apart.Same result.Got message," The customer you have called is not available at this time..."Gimmee a break.I assume they are out of business, but even if they are in business, it had to be out of the trunk of someone's car. My calls never returned.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Computers
Reviews.Content: This product is 4 years old. I purchased a "New" product on Amazon. When I got it, it was dirty and dusty. I contacted the manufacturer to get it working and the manufacturer told me that it was a registered product in 2010 and could not be used by anyone but the original owner.

Reviews.Title: worked perfectly, unlike new Foscam pos it replaced
Reviews.Author: William D. Gentry Jr. "Davis Gentry"
Reviews.Content: I had a Foscam unit which I ordered a few weeks ago.  Setup on it was difficult, tech support nonexistent, and remote viewing never worked.  This one set up easily, and one minor issue was quickly solved by tech support.  I would buy from these guys again.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: I bought this after reading the reviews, as I was after a quality product. I installed it easily from the website and set-up Wifi.So far:1. It works well inside. There is a delay between the image being picked-up and displayed on the screen on our laptop or iPad - this could be due to our internet connection - not sure (our internet is fast enought to Skype with).2. It reflects badly off windows at night when the camera is inside trying to look outside. I want the camera for this feature so have not worked this out yet.3. The CD did not work so had to install it from their website (which was easy, but part of why I gave this 4 and not 5 stars).4. As part of the set-up you use a private website to view and control the camera. This is free for basic service, but a constant upgrade banner appears when using it, so upgrading (which is only $25/year) seems the best option, but annoying given the cost of the camera (this is the second reason why it got 4 and not 5 stars).

Reviews.Title: Mole Wireless Network Camera by Astek
Reviews.Author: jaswu
Reviews.Content: Save a lot of money since no static internet connection is required. (Recommend at least 6 mps upload speed.)Software setup takes about 8-10 minutes on average. Take the time to do a wire connection since it is a lot more stable than wireless. (Mostly is the router problem not camera)

Reviews.Title: Great to have
Reviews.Author: Midwest
Reviews.Content: We have had this for months. I can access this from my IPhone, IPad,or computer.  We can watch our dogs and the pet sitters. I would never be without it.  Just plug it into your AT&T; receiver.  I am sure it is the same with any cable box.  Bought it at Costco.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Gail Scott
Reviews.Content: The installation was easy and fast.  Set up my camera to record to the SD Card and to YouTube within minutes. Accessing my camera through my Droid was a snap and the picture quality is excellent!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: docchow
Reviews.Content: easy to set up, reliable, can move the camera remotely,can record,and good website to view the picture, monitor your vacation home.

Reviews.Title: Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera (Black)
Reviews.Author: penname
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised. Well built and stylish. This camera is siting in my living room . I access it from my office and am able to tilt an pan anywhere in the room.

Reviews.Title: Astak Mole Carmera
Reviews.Author: MMKK
Reviews.Content: Great device, easy to setup and use.  Love the ability to view over my iPhone.. gives us a little extra peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional Security camera
Reviews.Author: breakers51
Reviews.Content: This security camera gives you the peace of mind when your away from your home, You can can sign in anywhere and check on your property and valuables. I recommended the Astak Mole camera  to a co-worker and he purchased one and he loves it. This camera exceeded my expectations!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good product. Using it for more than a year now
Reviews.Author: Kidu
Reviews.Content: This is a great product and has been working perfectly for more than an year now. The wireless spannin is so great. I use my ipad to connect to the camera from work to keep a watch on my nanny.

Reviews.Title: My Astak
Reviews.Author: KimoMusubi
Reviews.Content: Have installed two security cameras. One in my home on the mainland, and one in my vacation home in Hawaii. They both work flawlessly. I can access them from anywhere in the world. Great product !

Reviews.Title: Astak Mole Camera
Reviews.Author: Kari Eckel
Reviews.Content: Excellent surveillance camera at a nice price. It allows me to keep an eye on my elderly parents and thier house from across the country. When my father cut himself, it allowed me to examine the cut and advise him on treatment....from 2000 miles away. The pan and tilt capability is great.

Reviews.Title: Mole/ astak
Reviews.Author: Shear
Reviews.Content: This convenient video surveillance system is so easy to use. Customer service is always there for you & very helpful at all times. I feel very secure & safe working late @ night by myself knowing that my husband could always check online regarding my security.

Reviews.Title: The Best Security Camera Bar None!
Reviews.Author: Jon Pavlon "Jonny"
Reviews.Content: This thing is so amazing! I bought mine 2 years ago and it's still working perfectly! It's taken over 10,000 videos and over 100,000 photos. You will not be displeased!

Reviews.Title: First User Friendly Remote Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Mole for use at home in order to keep an eye on things while away. The software is simple to use and even that being said there are several online forums as well as the mfg's own to support setup and equipment. Being a techno geek I tend to look a bit more in depth and even so Astak's customer service was readily available to answer even the most bizarre of questions.I do not like having to use the online features simply because of the amount of time for log in which is why the you tube upload is a wonderful feature. also not complicated to set up I now can view my uploads from home, on my PC or on my smartphone anywhere I go.

Reviews.Title: OK Camera
Reviews.Author: Kim Cheung
Reviews.Content: Camera works well. Included SD card was defective and wouldn't record/write past a few hundred Mbs. Night images are slightly blurry and the color is definitely off, but minor details. Other than that, decent camera that does the job. Motion detector works well when set properly.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly in our warehouse
Reviews.Author: happycamper
Reviews.Content: This product works perfectly in our warehouse. No need for a DVR and all the complicated set up.  We simply followed the directions and were up and running in a few moments.  We can see what is happening at all times and needed that following some theft problems.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Tlum
Reviews.Content: Purchased this item to keep an eye on our pet while we are at work. Worked very well. Purchased a second unit for my mother-in-law who lives by herself and is hard of hearing. When she sleeps she cannot hear the phone rings so with the IP camera we just go online to see if she is ok or now.

Reviews.Title: The Amazing Mole
Reviews.Author: Schicke
Reviews.Content: We've had the Mole for a few years.  Our primary reason for purchase was as a security camera at our cottage after a theft.  As that turned out to be a one time incidence (thankfully)we've come to enjoy our Mole as a way to view the wildlife that frequents the yard when no one is there.  Its also handy to check on real time weather conditions (any storm damage, accumulating snow, etc.)Well worth the investment!

Reviews.Title: good, for the money - update
Reviews.Author: avid reader
Reviews.Content: Overall I have to say that I am satisfied with the camera. But... had a lot of trouble in the beginning. We received a replacement after all efforts to get the microphone/speakers option to work failed. It still does not work (note: you must have your own microphone (on the computer end) and powered speakers (on the camera end) for that feature to work - so I'm told!) but we enjoy being able to use it without sound anyway. We also like the app for the iPhone and that is much easier than the computer link, as the sign-in is saved. I wish they hadn't disabled the sign-in save feature in IE.It is not the easiest to set up - you have to follow the directions exactly, down to what you connect when, but if you do, it will find your wireless. It has been pretty reliable and we have actually used it to confirm that we haven't lost power at the house when we are on the way home from work during a storm.April 17, 2013 update:YOICS is a total joke. After repeatedly trying to get some customer support (I am a PRO user, meaning that I did fork over the extra $24.99 for SERVICE) with no response whatsoever (by email, by chat, by phone). There is never support available. I'm not sure that there are even people there anymore.the iPhone app use to work fine, except now every time I try to move the camera, I get the message that my alloted time is up and it shuts down. I am going to call Astak to ask if there is any other way to use the camera other than YOICS. They teamed up with a loser here...

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Bruce W Goetze
Reviews.Content: This camera has all the features you need and they all actually work. I am very pleased with my purchase. In fact, I own 4 of them.

Reviews.Title: Astak Mole
Reviews.Author: Fantolio "Fantolio"
Reviews.Content: I have five of these online, four in my parents' house in Texas and one in my house in California. When I travel back and forth, I need to be able to see what is happening on the other end. I have used these for three years, and they have performed flawlessly, with both wired and wifi configurations. I have one set up to upload video to my YouTube account. The other four capture the video on the built-in simm card. I think the two-way audio only works through Windows systems. I use them almost everyday.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup - works great!
Reviews.Author: obxhomeboy
Reviews.Content: I've had my Astak Mole for over a year now, and it has been on continuously the whole time. Still works as good as the day I bought it. Setup was very easy but must be performed with the camera hard-wired (CAT-5) to the network. Once you've done that, you can disconnect and place it anywhere within the range of your wi-fi. The pan/tilt mechanism is extremely quiet - can't hear it at all unless you're right up next to it. The IR lights come on automatically when the available light gets low, and color shifts to black & white. Picture is clear in total darkness out to about 25 feet. My only complaint is the lack of a zoom lens, but at the asking price, well you can't have everything!  I've found it great for monitoring my property when away and to see what mischief my dog gets into when I'm not around. The web-based interface means you can access it from any computer, anywhere. There's about a 5-6 second delay for the camera to respond to pan/tilt commands, so don't expect to be able to manually follow a live moving object in real time. Not a big deal for most.

Reviews.Title: Mole Camera
Reviews.Author: Goldensrock
Reviews.Content: I purchased it from Costco and had it up in running in no time.  I especially likethe app. that lets you access and adjust the camera from your smart phone.I am very pleased, it works great, I also record a steady stream 24/7 on a 32 gig.card, it will record for about five days.

Reviews.Title: Astak Mole
Reviews.Author: Grimy
Reviews.Content: The mole installation is quite simple than I thought, the quick setup guide and FAQ are helpful. I just follow the instruction, step by step, without any problem. Once plug in the AC power, Mole will automatically pan and tilt. The WIFI setup was a snap!!My kids think it is the coolest thing to contole with there phones.

Reviews.Title: the best Network camera available today
Reviews.Author: Man Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Easiest setup ever. You can listen sound from the internet view.I bought 2 set of this to set up at my mom's house so I can look to see how my mom doing daily make sure she won't felt down and I can access these camera 24/7.

Reviews.Title: Astak Mole good for basic function as remote camera
Reviews.Author: TC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a quick way to set up a remote access camera for general home security and to monitor my cat in her favorite part of the house.  For those purposes, this is good.  Certainly, there are cheaper ways to do it, especially if you have a computer always running, but this is convenient when you want to keep minimal hardware running, and you need pan/tilt control and flexible mounting.  I had hoped that a family of products would develop that support the yoics.net access portal, since it would be convenient for home automation and the monitoring of home security systems.  But as of now, it really only supports cameras (including others besides the Mole) and remote storage devices.

Reviews.Title: Mole camera by Astak Inc.
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Camera works great.  Got it for recording surveilance at night.  Picture is great in the dark.  Also love the upload to youtube feature.  I also use the android app that's free to check in on it periodically.  Easy to set up and change settings with a browser.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Easy set-up, works every time
Reviews.Author: Alby's Dad
Reviews.Content: Was expecting setting up the Mole camera on my WiFi network to be difficult; on the contrary it couldn't have been easier! Using the web interface or the apps for the iPhone and iPad, I can check on my furry friend at any time during the day. Now if only he would move off of the couch and give me something to watch.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, easy setup
Reviews.Author: J. Mursuli "gadget_man"
Reviews.Content: I give this camera 5 stars for being the easiest IP camera to set up. I have 6 cameras transmitting via WiFi at my house. You set it up with an Ethernet cable connected to your router then at the end of the setup you connect it to WiFi and test it.  It took about 5-10 minutes per camera.You can view the cameras online via web page or smartphone. I use it with an IPhone and it works great. Online you can pan, tilt, & rotate. You can view all the cameras on the same web screen and change any of the settings while using your computer or smartphone. Since I chose to record all videos to YouTube I can sign on to YouTube to view any of the 30 seconds that any of the cameras recorded. It's nice cause it only records motion at your predetermined area of the screen. You can even change the motion sensitivity.Night vision is good since I believe it can see up to 30 feet.The online account is free with limited views but you can pay $25.00 per year for a Premium account to get unlimited views and other cool features.I've had it for over a month and it works great.I'll update my review once I've had it longer.

Reviews.Title: SIX STARS!
Reviews.Author: NETARTSBAY
Reviews.Content: Couldnt say enough about this unit!  Have had it up and running for over a year-100% satisfaction- easy set up- havent had a problem at all- use it for security at our beach home- email alerts and dial up any time I want. Easy to use - cant say enough!

Reviews.Title: easy setup
Reviews.Author: alco
Reviews.Content: i have one of these in the house, it automatically notifies me of anyone entering via email on my phone,  very easy to set up.  this is a nice way to see what is going on anywhere there is a wifi service.  you can pan and tilt this camera from anywhere you have internet service.

Reviews.Title: Functional IP Camera with reponsive tech support
Reviews.Author: Peter Nechay "Peter Doc"
Reviews.Content: I'm now an owner of a Mole.  The device is quite nifty actually.  While there are some issues others have noted with the software etc., the Mole is preforming well for me.  I have it trained on my front door.  I have side widowns for the door and have the motion detecting windows of the device set on the side widow and the door as well as in front of the door so I can see when the cat is checking things out.  The Yoics service does a good job of linking the camera up to my iPhone so I can see what is going on in the home.  The resuliution is ok.  The ease of setup is very good.  I was using the firefox browser and only could set up one window for motion acitvated recodring.  I was easily able to reach online tech support in 1 minute and they helped me set up IE to access the camera, opening up much better functionality.  I will let others comment about security and such.  It looks to me like my network key is blanked and not stored in plain text.  So in all a fun toy that helps me track things going on in my house while im gone.  And a certain wearehouse club C.... makes the Mole very affordable.  :)

Reviews.Title: Stylish IP camera
Reviews.Author: Pingpong
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th IP camera I owned since year 2008. It's not box type, looks good in my room. I wish they can make white one. Easy to install. It's not the perfect IP camera, but it works as it claimed to. The only suggestion: the blinking LED is really bothering me at night. I wish I can turn them all off.

Reviews.Title: I'm sure it'd be great... IF it worked
Reviews.Author: The Den
Reviews.Content: Straight out of the box (from Costco) the camera showed up as already registered to someone else.  After a week of playing with this thing, and two days of support from the company, they finally told me to return it to Costco.So much for "anyone" can use it.  The camera showed up locally, but there was NO way to set it up for remote viewing, as it would not register.  Meanwhile, while setting up their software and trying to get my computer to recognize it, guess what showed up for remote viewing?  My logitech computer camera.  Nice. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: Serious Q&A; Issues
Reviews.Author: Marco Rodrigues
Reviews.Content: I'm by no means a troll and I hardly write reviews - but I've tried to use this camera with little to no success. I recently purchased one of these at Costco and the first attempt yielded a camera with a busted motor (it wouldn't pan down). After reading some reviews (which I foolishly agree I should've done before purchasing this) - I still went ahead and exchanged the camera. The 2nd attempt was a better experience, but every 2-3 days the camera would disconnect itself from my wireless network. Support told me I need to 'reset' the device once this condition occurs - which is ludicrous. I have 4 IP Sharx web camera's and I've never had to ever 'reset' one in order to restore functionality - and I've had some running for almost 1+ years (on UPS). The camera itself is a great product (HW wise) - but the software is a complete joke and lacks much Q&A.; No firmware upgrades were available and support seemed to indicate nothing was coming anytime soon (I guess they need to recognize there's a problem first..)I will never be buying this camera again nor any from this company. Back to IP Sharx, while it doesn't have panning - I'm guaranteed to have a video stream when I need it most.

Reviews.Title: Search goes on...
Reviews.Author: g-man
Reviews.Content: I have been researching home IP cams for about 6 months already. My requirements are quite simple: wireless, IP, alarm, 30 fps, ideally H234 compression, IR illumination, preferably wide angle lens, no dependency on external site/provider, <$200 price and obviously quality/reliability.This camera, based on specs, fits the bill, and if everything worked according to specs it would get different number of stars. However, it all doesn't matter if you can get wireless working only for 5 min, 6 feet from the router.All subsequent attempts to get wireless working were unsuccessful, close or far from the router.
