Another downfall is that there is no auto focus, you must get your subject first and manually turn and focus in.  I hope they launch better software...

Reviews.Title: Astak Mole Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: Using this with Mac OS10. What a piece of garbage. You must use 3rd party software (YOICS) to operate the camera, either wired or wireless. This software is free, but the 3rd party is continuously trying to upsell you to a full featured version of the free software. On a MAC you must create terminal commands to make the software work. The software provides the IP address for the camera, so if you want to view it remotely (of course you would, that's why you bought the camera) you must have the camera connected to a MAC running the YOICS software and connected to your local wireless network. The remote connection is made through the local MAC. You thought you were getting a camera for 200 bucks, but now you need to dedicate a thousand dollar computer to make it operable.The camera is very particular about the wireless security. You will need to reduce your security level (use a more basic encryption) to make the unit connect to your wireless network. A mobile app is available to view the camera remotely (see above for setup). By the way the app is $2.99 on iTunes.Stay away from this. It is a very weak implementation and is by no means simple to setup.

Reviews.Title: Pay them more! Obfuscating ads and ad hell. Evil software. Delivered less. Pay them more! Use EvoCam.
Reviews.Author: TAAMinator "taaminator"
Reviews.Content: (if you use Apple) AVOID the Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera (CM-MOLE).The construction is very lightweight plastic. The pan/tilt gears grind disturbingly. The microphone is vintage-45 or less quality.Advertising Makes It Not Happen #1The advertising implies that the Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera (CM-MOLE) is a DVR. It's a DVR *IF* you purchase an 8G SD card. Even if it's connected directly to a powerful workstation, it won't record. You must pay more to play - Or, in this case, record.The advertising implies that MOLE is an webcam. The webcam won't work at all unless you register it with YOICS (free). You have a paperweight until you go to YOICS. After you register, you have a partially functional, unreliable webcam. It's an webcam *IF* and only *IF* you pay $26 annually to ASTAK for their YOICS service.The advertising implies that MOLE is an ipcam. The ipcam won't work at all unless you register it with YOICS (free). Repeat previous paragraph.The advertising implies that you can stream and record and share your MOLE content with friend and YouTube. You 'can' stream, after you register with YOICS, but, then, YOICS (or the software or the firmware or the hardware) turns off the ipcam after a couple of hours.In YOICS's large print it implies that you can share and upload. In the fine print it says that you can share, kinda-sorta, but you are limited on what you can share, limited on quantity of bandwidth, and, you do not get 'priority' bandwidth. If you pay them $26 annually and you get moved to the front of the line and you get to share with your friends. Note the lawyers' chorus: FriendsarelimitedtotenandmustberegisteredYOICSuserspay$26anuallyandalsouseAstakPanTiltNighVisionIPNetworkCamera.Evil SoftwareThe installation and usage software does what it wants when it wants and in the order it wants. If you deviate from the software's unpublished steps, you fail. Even if you follow the unwritten rules of life, the software might fail. And, yes, the download manual is as bad as one would expect. It contains little functional information. When you go to ASTAK's site, it tells you there's a firmware update. The link 404s.The pan and tilt software controls are sluggish and rudimentary. The buttons depress on selection, but you never really know if they took input or just moved to get you to go away. The incomplete manual doesn't cover it or answer questions.  At least the pan and tilt software controls don't show up in your remote browser.I still haven't figured out how to successfully share. There's a sharing page on YOICS. You enter your friends' emails. You select "Send." Nothing happens. It must have something to do with that 8G SD card, not included, or paying $26 annually to YOICS.The software/website allow you to configure the port for port mapping purposes. It's a red herring. The port mapping doesn't work. It maps to wherever it wants to map.Advertising Makes It Not Happen #2When you go to YOICS and register, EVERY page diverts to an advertisement suggesting that you pay $26 annually to YOICS. EVERY page.When you finally get the whole thing on, configured, and 'streaming', you discover that the software leaves a large hole in your security wall. (Without paying the $26 annually) You either share your unencrypted password with the world or you don't share. It says 'admin', 'user', and 'guest'. It's actually 'Come and get it!'And it has an amazingly nasty knack of ignoring you when you tell it to remember your login and password. "Remember me?" "Yes!" "Sucker!"Tech Suppor- Gotta go.On the positive side, their chat-live tech was very responsive - for the first three or four questions. Then they quit responding. In mid-conversation they disconnected.User: "Just like the software instructions said, I did this step then this step."Tech: "Don't do that."ConclusionIf you purchase the Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera (CM-MOLE), be prepared. It doesn't work until you register. It isn't fully functional without an 8G SD card. It doesn't configure readily, easily, or understandably. It doesn't share. It shuts down of its own free will. YOICS constantly begs for $26 and promises 'more'. If you don't pay the $26, you are scum and won't receive equal treatment under the YOICS law.Ads. Obfuscation. Ads. Evil. Ads. Less is the norm. Ads.#####[Insert Apple logos via Option-Shift-k, here.]Apple AlternativesMOLE and EvoCamEvological's EvoCam supports the Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera. You can use EvoCam to stream video from the  Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera through your router or computer. EvoCam accesses the pan and tilt controls - and they work better than YOICS's web-based controls.As one would expect from someone who hadn't paid their $26 annually to YOICS, either Astak Pan/Tilt Night Vision IP Network Camera turns itself off or YOICS terminates the camera-computer link every couple of hours even though the video stream is NOT going through YOICS.iSight and EvoCamBuy a couple of Apple iSights on ebay for $50 each. Unfortunately, iSights are NOT pan and tilt.Buy EvoCam for $30. With EvoCam, you can stream and record audio, stills, and video. You can do time lapse. You can web server or ftp or email server. You can schedule. EvoCam works great with iCloud. EvoCam performs http live streaming with HTML5. You can view your iSights from anywhere.Configure.Create tinyurl links to your iSight/EvoCam ports.Enjoy the way Astak Mole SHOULD be!-30-

Reviews.Title: Not as good as the manufacturer claims
Reviews.Author: Video Jockey
Reviews.Content: I connected the camera with little difficulty and could view the image via my own network.  Connecting remotely was a bit more difficult, but made it through okay.  However, the quality of the image is FAR from HD....far from SD, for that matter.  The color is horrible and quality of the image makes images of the original moon landing look like a million bucks.  I contacted customer support, they jumped on to my desktop, and claimed the image was just as good as the samples on their website.  I just had my eyes checked, so I think they need to do the same.  Here's the last actual online conversation:Jane:Welcome to Digital Support Technology. My name is Jane and I am a Microsoft Certified Professional. I will assist you today.Jane:hime:helloJane:what's the issue you are facing?me:As I told "Denny", the image on my camera is awful.  He looked, said it was alright, then cut off the conversation.  It is horrible!!!  Not even a SD image, let alone HD as it is supposed to be.Jane:oh ,i am afraid that there is no problem with your mole camme:REALLY?  Why is it so distorted compared to those images on your examples?????Jane:the resolution mole can support is up to 640x480me:So, why is it so different than the examples shown on your website?Jane:that's the 640x480 imagesme:So.....this image -[...] is the same as mine?Jane:yesme:Have you compared both?  How can anyone say they're the same quality?????Jane:yesme:I will save this conversation when I pursue this further.  I don't know what YOU'RE looking at, but the two aren't even closeJane:fineSpend far less money on another camera that can be viewed in another manner than their website, which constantly requests you to upgrade to their "Pro" package for $24.95/year.  Otherwise you're limited on how long you can view each day.

Reviews.Title: WARNING WiFi network cannot use spaces in password!
Reviews.Author: Robert Alan Butcher
Reviews.Content: I was excited to try this camera out. Setup went easy until I tried to have it join my WiFi network. The product does not recognize passwords with spaces in them so if your network uses any spaces (who knows what else it doesn't understand), then don't make the mistake of buying this camera.Tech support suggested I change the password of my network so this thing can play nicely. This is ridiculous. If you have any other devices on the network, they all must be reconfigured because of lazy software design by Astak.My chat with text support was ever so useful:Rob:WiFi code not supported error.Please help.iMac Lion OS trying to set up camera to WiFi network.  Call accepted by operator Alex. Currently in room: Rob, Alex.Alex:What is the code?Rob:XXX XXX XXXAlex:With spaces?Rob:yesAlex:Spaces are not supportedRob:how do I return this poorly designed piece of software?Alex:can the wifi pw be changed?Alex:REmove the spaceRob:Changing the password for every other device on the network so that this can work? No thank you. I will return this instead.Rob:how do I return this poorly designed piece of software?Alex:Return to the store where you purchased itAlex:Bye
